Key Match Events: The Cleveland Cavaliers won 129-122 against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Cleveland led the last 9:05 of the game, although it was almost entirely within five points.
The Thunder forced 15 turnovers and got nine steals.
Donovan Mitchell, the Cavs' leading scorer, was forced to shoot 3-of-16 from the field, scoring 11 points.
Evan Mobley grabbed 10 rebounds and Jarrett Allen grabbed 11 rebounds for the Cavs.
Isaiah Hartenstein grabbed 11 rebounds for the Thunder.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored a game-high 31 points but went 1-of-6 from long range.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder will play the Cavs at home on Jan. 16, which could bring a different dynamic.
David Aldridge of The Athletic requested a seven-game series between the Thunder and Cavs.
Bob Ryan declared Thunder-Cavs to be 'basketball as it should be.'
